jamesLogger

Class Log

  • java.lang.Object
    • jamesLogger.Log

  • public class Log
extends Object
    This class is used to avoid just printing to the console. A simple logger that is easy to use and light weight, as well as thread safe. Great for debugging and watching what happens as your program executes.
    Version:
    0.5 By default the logger uses a buffer of 100, writes to the file %CD%\Log\LogFile.txt where CD is the current directory. Operates with all messages 1 to 3 in level logged.
    Author:
    James Carl Harris

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private int buffer
      This is used as the size of the buffer for messages to be written.
      private String logFileName
      This is the name of the log file for this logger.
      private String logFolder
      The folder where the logs are stored.
      private int maxLevel
      Used to determine what level messages are logged.
      private String[] msgBuffer
      This is the buffer for the logger.
      private int pos
      Pos is used with buffer to manage the Buffer for writing lines to the log file.
      private boolean toFile
      This determines if the log writes to a file.
      private boolean tree
      This determines if the log logs all messages from 1 to the max, or just the max and 1.

    • Field Detail

      • pos

        private int pos
        Pos is used with buffer to manage the Buffer for writing lines to the log file.
        See Also:
        msgBuffer

      • buffer

        private int buffer
        This is used as the size of the buffer for messages to be written.
        See Also:
        msgBuffer

      • msgBuffer

        private String[] msgBuffer
        This is the buffer for the logger. Used to minimize the number of file open and closes.

      • toFile

        private boolean toFile
        This determines if the log writes to a file.

      • maxLevel

        private int maxLevel
        Used to determine what level messages are logged. Similar to setting a log to info or debug, however this has no predetermined log levels. Think of level 1 as Highest priority, and lower levels of priority any thing greater.

      • tree

        private boolean tree
        This determines if the log logs all messages from 1 to the max, or just the max and 1. True logs all levels.

      • logFileName

        private String logFileName
        This is the name of the log file for this logger.

      • logFolder

        private String logFolder
        The folder where the logs are stored. Starts from Current Directory.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Log

        public Log(int logBufferSize,
   boolean writeToFile,
   int lvl,
   boolean tree,
   String logFileName,
   String logFolder)
        This is the constructor to create a custom logger.
        Parameters:
        logBufferSize - Determines log buffer size.
        writeToFile - Determines weather or not to write to file.
        lvl - Max level of messages to log. Not maximum number of messages to log.
        tree - Determines if the logger logs as a tree or just max level and level 1. True logs all levels
        logFileName - Name for the log file.
        logFolder - name for the log folder. Treated relative to the Current Directory. Do not use and absolute path, and do not end with \. EX: logFolder , The\Log\Folder , or THElog : But not \LOGS\ , \Log , or Log\

      • Log

        public Log(int logBufferSize,
   boolean writeToFile,
   int lvl,
   boolean tree,
   String logFileName)
        This is the constructor to create a custom logger.
        Parameters:
        logBufferSize - Determines log buffer size.
        writeToFile - Determines weather or not to write to file.
        lvl - Max level of messages to log. Not maximum number of messages to log.
        tree - Determines if the logger logs as a tree or just max level and level 1. True logs all levels
        logFileName - Name for the log file. Places the file in the Current Directory.

      • Log

        public Log()
        Makes a generic logger. That prints to console with buffer of 100 and logging all messages up to Level 3.

       String msg)
        Adds the message to the log buffer. lvl is the priority level of the message.
        Parameters:
        lvl - Level of message.
        msg - Message to be written.
